reasoning: Hashimoto's thyroiditis is a chronic autoimmune disease, measured by prevalence rather than incidence. Global prevalence estimated at ~2% of population (2,000 per 100k), with significant gender variation (more common in women). Confidence reflects good epidemiological evidence but variability in population screening methods.
source: American Thyroid Association; Epidemiology of autoimmune thyroid disease, based on multi-center studies and population screening data
